pages.text: Static heat sources are:$(li)Air$(li)Ice$(li)Packed Ice$(li)Snow$(li)Torch$(li)Fire$(li)Magma$(li)Any Liquid (including Water and Lava)
$(p)All of these blocks will add or remove heat to machines when adjacent to them. When too much heat is added or removed, they may transform into other (non-heat-source) blocks.
A $(l:machines/vortex_tube)Vortex Tube/$ converts $(l:base_concepts/pressure)pressure/$ directly to heat and cold.
A $(l:semiblocks/heat_frame)Heat Frame/$ is a gadget that can be used to heat (or freeze!) items in any inventory.
A $(l:machines/heat_sink)Heat Sink/$ is a block that can be used to disperse Heat (or cold!) from the block it's attached to, into the atmosphere.

$(bold)Heating a Furnace/$$(p)When connecting a $(item)Furnace/$ to any dynamic heat source (such as a $(l:machines/vortex_tube)Vortex Tube/$, but also blocks like the $(l:compressors/advanced_air_compressor)Advanced Air Compressor/$ which produces heat), the heat will be consumed by the Furnace to 'fuel' it. The Furnace will smelt faster the higher the temperature. This effect can be stacked with multiple heat sources around the Furnace. This furnace 'fueling' will start to work at 100Â°C.
